Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the track record of not raising taxes by Gov. Rick Perry, as there is evidence of tax increases during his tenure.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that Gov. Perry has signed into law higher taxes on fireworks and cigarettes, as well as changes in business taxation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that Gov. Perry has a track record of not raising taxes, as evidence of tax increases exists.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the statement made by Gov. Perry about not raising taxes is accurate, without questioning its validity.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as some argue that certain fee increases can be considered a form of tax increase.
